title: Hidden message in poster
content:
[http://blog.wired.com/underwire/2009/03/sxsw-objectifie.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020211232/http:/blog.wired.com/underwire/2009/03/sxsw-objectifie.html "http://blog.wired.com/underwire/2009/03/sxsw-objectifie.html")

I can see the word "objectified", "apple" and "fan boy" but I'm having trouble reading the other messages in the poster. Any ideas?
author: Si_Daniels

comments.content:
The last thing is a G5 computer, late at night. Go figure...

The guy must be single.

_The last thing is a G5 computer. Go figure..._

Mac Pro looks exactly the same.
Sorry. I just see those kind of machines on pictures (these days).

The last row of images are the gadgets used to make the movie. :-)

[http://www.objectifiedfilm.com/blog/the-official-objectified-poster/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020211232/http:/www.objectifiedfilm.com/blog/the-official-objectified-poster/ "http://www.objectifiedfilm.com/blog/the-official-objectified-poster/")
The hidden message could be: Look, I finally found some use for my clipart.
I don't think it's very special. To be honest. It's ok.

Well, probably more the [Neubau Welt](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020211232/http:/www.amazon.com/Neubau-Welt-Stefan-Gandl/dp/3899550722) book with all the vector cliparts (they might even have used some of those for the poster).

I'm too busy and too old to chase down hidden meanings.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~

[_...from the Fontry_](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020211232/http:/www.thefontry.com/)
has anyone just asked Build about it?
